result.execSummary:
The defendant Alysia E Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $250/mo commencing on 11/13/15.  Failure to make payments when due will result in one day jail for each $25 outstanding.
Submit to DNA sample at the Ozaukee County Jail by 10/30/15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alysia E Ramirez

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alysia E Ramirez in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court received Counsels Supplemental Brief. No additional argument. Court denies motion. Case passed. Case recalled at 9:15 am; same appearances. Matter proceeds to dispo.
Supplemental Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress.   Scanned and forwarded to Branch 3 for review.
Atty Hartley mentioned in oral ruling of brief that he had faxed over on 9/2/15.  Court never recieved brief.  Clerk contacted Atty Hartley's office and asked to re-fax.
Status hearing at 10-13-2015 08:15 am

Defendant Alysia E Ramirez in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties stipulate to officer did not return defendant's license until after arrest at the police department. Supplemental argument by parties. Court orders adjournment to review brief filed by Atty Hartley. Status Hearing if Judge has not filed written ruling.  Status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.
August 5, 2015 / Motion Hearing / Lisa Balkowski
Oral ruling at 09-03-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Alysia E Ramirez in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Suppress heard. Deputy Becky Swanson sworn and testified. State rests subject to rebuttal. Statement by Atty Wabitsch. Statement by counsel. The court will allow counsel and state  to submit written arguments with court to give oral ruling.  Oral ruling scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alysia E Ramirez in court, in custody. Atty Alme-Boaz appears as a friend of the court. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will hire counsel. State requesting $100 cash bail.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.
